intro: Cacalia peltigera, commonly known as the common cacalia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Cacalia peltigera is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
